organization.description: Our mission is to provide binational solutions to issues that arise during the application of United States - Mexico treaties regarding boundary demarcation, national ownership of waters, sanitation, water quality, and flood control in the border region.
organization.title: International Boundary & Water Commission
organization.name: ibwc-gov

name: international-boundary-united-states-mexico-minute-315
notes:
This provisional international boundary was developed by the International Boundary and Water Commission-United States and Mexico
               (IBWC), to be used as a common boundary for the clipping and geometric integration of binational geospatial data sets and represents the international
               boundary as agreed upon by the Governments of the United States and Mexico in accordance with the 1970 Boundary Treaty. It provides an electronic,
               spatially referenced representation of the international boundary that may be used for the purposes of displaying the boundary and to integrate
               binational datasets tied into the boundary line.  The international boundary contained in this dataset corresponds to the line displayed in the
	       2008 IBWC Boundary Maps, which were approved by Minute 315 in November 2009.  Please note that this boundary is only for reference purposes.  If there is
	       a need for a legal or authoritative boundary location, do NOT use this dataset.  Instead, contact the IBWC Boundary and Realty Office.

extras.value:

                     IBWC, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific
                     purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty.  Please note that this boundary is only for reference purposes.  If there is
	      	     a need for a legal or authoritative boundary location, do NOT use this dataset.  Instead, contact the IBWC Boundary and Realty Office. "]

["Use Constraints: Accuracy of the data is not guaranteed. Users should be aware that temporal changes might have occurred since
                     these data were collected and that some parts of the data might no longer represent actual surface conditions. Users should not use these data for
                     critical applications without a full awareness of their limitations. Acknowledgment of the originating agencies would be appreciated in products
                     derived from these data. Any user who modifies the data is obligated to describe the modifications made. User specifically agrees not to
                     misrepresent the data, nor to imply that changes made were approved or endorsed by the IBWC. Please refer to <http://www.ibwc.gov/> for the
                     U.S. IBWC general disclaimer.", "Access Constraints: None"]
